... but something you should be aware of.  If you are at all invested
in th=
e stock market (and most are nowadays due to 401k and IRA
accounts and the =
like), you should be aware of the fraud perpetrated
at the highest levels i=
n the equity markets.  You may have recently
heard of Gary Aguirre, a Secur=
ities and Exchange Commission
investigator who had evidence of insider trad=
ing at Pequot Capital
Management, a large hedge fund.  In his pursuit of th=
e investigation,
he asked to subpoena the former Pequot CEO who was in char=
ge during
the possible malfeasance.  But this person, John Mack, is a perso=
nal
friend of, and large campaign contributor to, The Prez.  And so the
ins=
ider trading investigation was terminated without explanation by
the SEC ex=
ecutives, and Mr. Aguirre was summarily fired, also without
explanation, an=
d only eleven days after having received a glowing
performance evaluation a=
nd substantial salary raise.  I don't wish to
turn this board into a politi=
cal rant'n'rave wastepit, and so will say
no more here.  Nor do I encourage=
 anyone else to respond here.  I only
want to get the word out and perhaps =
stimulate others to get hot on
this fraud issue and perhaps address it in b=
etter suited venues.  This
incredible corruption is not a Democrat vs. Repu=
blican dynamic, the
politicians are all in it, save a few such as Rep. Ron =
Paul of Texas
and Senator Tom Coburn of Oklahoma.  Otherwise, they mostly a=
ll
provide political cover for the large corporations and Wall Street
firms=
 raping the individual investors.  Here is the link to Mr.
Aguirre's testim=
ony today to the Senate Committee on the Judiciary. 
Lengthy read, but well=
 worthwhile.  Whether you determine to do
something or just close your eyes=
, so be it (but no return rants here,
please).

http://judiciary.senate.gov=
/testimony.cfm?id=3D1972&wit_id=3D5485
